channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: The 15-year-old Russian figure skater Kamila Valieva said she was taking substances to treat a heart ailment. But experts say two of the drugs detected in her blood aren't regularly used in cardiology. https://t.co/FAMskbOe1t

An investigation was launched after a Harvard University graduate student accused a professor of sexually harassing her. What happened next stunned her.
Harvard obtained her therapy notes and gave them to the professor, according to a lawsuit. https://t.co/X58Uo6dx3v
Infants whose mothers received two doses of an mRNA vaccine during pregnancy are less likely to be hospitalized for Covid in the first six months of life, a CDC study found. https://t.co/xSESfx2RXK

Breaking News: President Biden, rejecting Donald Trump’s executive privilege claim, is ordering the release of White House visitor logs to the Jan. 6 panel. He informed the National Archives that the logs should be turned over within 15 days. https://t.co/HHx3ORSA0N
Our bodies were “not designed for the kinds of stressors that we face today,” a social psychologist said. Here’s how to recognize burnout in your body and what to do about it. https://t.co/D5OsMmgLHJ

Valérie Pécresse, a candidate for president of France, used the phrase "great replacement," referencing a racist conspiracy theory, in a speech over the weekend, fueling criticism from both her opponents as well as allies within her party. https://t.co/c7zxpRNko3

Why are truckers blocking roads in Canada? What's happening now? Will the protests spread to the U.S.? @sarahmaslinnir is on the scene and will discuss the latest developments with @porterthereport and @sheeraf on Wednesday, Feb. 16, at 5 p.m. ET. https://t.co/tkEOXET8rI
Coachella will not require attendees to wear masks — or be vaccinated or tested for the coronavirus — when the festival returns for the first time in two years this April. https://t.co/Q9nhHL0U5a

A woman of mixed race appears to be the third person ever to be cured of HIV, using a new transplant method involving umbilical cord blood that could make a cure available to more people of diverse racial backgrounds, scientists announced on Tuesday. https://t.co/kuGXmL94oZ https://t.co/IeYO4grOIB

The pastor of a Catholic church in Phoenix incorrectly performed thousands of baptisms over more than 20 years by changing one word in the ritual, a church investigation found.
“I deeply regret my error,” said the pastor, who has resigned. https://t.co/51WIi3lhr7
Our bodies were “not designed for the kinds of stressors that we face today,” a social psychologist said. Here’s how to recognize burnout in your body and what to do about it. https://t.co/gWo8beBfLe

The U.S. government has requested the arrest and extradition of Juan Orlando Hernández, the former Honduran president who has been accused in New York of receiving money from drug cartels. https://t.co/fLZHnulgXJ

Breaking News: The Russian figure skater Kamila Valieva had other drugs that can be used to treat heart conditions in her system before the Olympics. Only one is banned, according to documents reviewed by The New York Times. https://t.co/grTlko0msR

Dennis Hope has spent 27 years alone in a Texas prison cell smaller than a compact parking space. Last month, he asked the Supreme Court to consider setting limits on prolonged isolation under the Eighth Amendment, which bars cruel and unusual punishments. https://t.co/OuUHz6IdYH https://t.co/xFWd6LMQMy

Breaking News: A woman of mixed race appears to be the third person ever to be cured of HIV, using a new treatment that could make a cure available to more people of diverse racial backgrounds, scientists announced on Tuesday. https://t.co/MlDn6pazHl

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police said it arrested 11 people and seized a cache of weapons — including long guns, handguns, a machete, body armor and a large quantity of ammunition and magazines — linked to protesters at a border crossing in Alberta. https://t.co/jwTClIBaQe

Breaking News: Prince Andrew settled a sexual abuse lawsuit with Virginia Giuffre, one of Jeffrey Epstein’s accusers, according to a new court filing in Manhattan on Tuesday. Financial terms were not disclosed. https://t.co/TYOu3UhnuX

Novak Djokovic is prepared to miss the French Open, Wimbledon and other tennis tournaments if a Covid vaccine is required to compete, he said in a BBC interview. Being free to choose what goes in his body is “more important than any title,” he said. https://t.co/QjkmSbO0yx

Breaking News: Russia said some troops were being pulled back from around Ukraine, a sign of potential de-escalation. But large-scale drills are continuing.
Follow live updates. https://t.co/npIFp9pzqj

Peter Thiel, one of Donald Trump’s biggest donors in 2016, is now a key financier of the MAGA movement. The tech billionaire is backing 16 Senate and House candidates, many of whom have embraced the lie that Trump won the election. https://t.co/bWwv5brH2H
New York City fired 1,430 city workers — less than 1% of its workforce — on Friday for failing to comply with its vaccine mandate. https://t.co/a4KbtTiRLY

Adam Rippon, the Olympian who is now a coach, criticized the decision to let the Russian skater Kamila Valieva compete, saying postponing the team figure skating medals ceremony "robbed" athletes and those who helped them succeed of the podium experience. https://t.co/syuyslXTl3

Leaked data said to be from a crowdfunding platform that was posted by hackers suggests many of the larger donors to the Canadian trucker convoy are wealthy Canadians, though one of the biggest donations was made in the name of an American tech billionaire.https://t.co/rXjnV1FvKX

The American sprinter Sha’Carri Richardson, who lost her spot on the U.S. team for the 2020 Summer Olympics after she tested positive for marijuana, questioned why the Russian skater Kamila Valieva could compete after failing a doping test. https://t.co/guV7BX6mdv
Breaking News: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau invoked an emergency law in Canada for the first time in 50 years to quell widespread anti-government protests. https://t.co/CRykcXjcI1
Breaking News: Donald Trump’s accounting firm cut ties with his company and retracted financial statements central to two investigations, court papers show. https://t.co/bZqzFt6aAC

The American sprinter Sha’Carri Richardson, who lost her spot on the U.S. team for the 2020 Summer Olympics after she tested positive for marijuana, questioned why the Russian skater Kamila Valieva could compete after failing a doping test. https://t.co/CmPMgKpHtr https://t.co/R1BdVQT41r

The pastor of a Catholic church in Phoenix incorrectly performed thousands of baptisms over more than 20 years by changing one word in the ritual, a church investigation found.
“I deeply regret my error,” said the pastor, who has resigned. https://t.co/gJOy81t4qH

Artists who live in New York state and can demonstrate financial need are being invited to apply for $1,000 a month for 18 months, no strings attached, to make it easier to spend time on creative work. https://t.co/qbpsmgO3eE

A 35-year-old woman was killed in her Manhattan apartment by a man who followed her into her building, the police said. Identified as Christina Yuna Lee, she was the latest person of Asian descent injured or killed in a string of attacks in New York City. https://t.co/S3PK7rEyHx

During the Super Bowl halftime show, Eminem took a knee and held his head after performing "Lose Yourself." An NFL spokesman said the league was aware that he was planning to kneel. https://t.co/lfYYWoqjMI https://t.co/CPwt7TNBi6

Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, Eminem, Kendrick Lamar, Mary J. Blige and 50 Cent asserted the power of hip-hop’s oldies generation on pop music’s most-watched stage, our critic @joncaramanica writes of the Super Bowl halftime show. https://t.co/JfbKg2B16H

During the Super Bowl halftime show, Eminem took a knee and held his head after performing “Lose Yourself,” his anthem about self-determination from the movie “8 Mile.” An NFL spokesman said the league was aware that he was planning to kneel. https://t.co/ZMZC0IMc0d

An American Airlines flight from Los Angeles to Washington, D.C., made an emergency landing in Kansas City, Mo., after a passenger tried to break into the cockpit and then tried to open an exit door, witnesses said. He has been taken into custody. https://t.co/hGsD4Pfe3o

Russia has continued to strengthen its military presence around Ukraine. New Russian deployments in Crimea, Belarus and near eastern Ukraine have furthered fears of an imminent invasion. Here's a look at where the troops are positioned. https://t.co/sGuw6amZgh

Breaking News: Kamila Valieva, the Russian figure skating star at the center of a doping scandal, will be allowed to continue competing in the #Beijing2022 Olympics. https://t.co/vQoJ1goYzi https://t.co/CA4Q9czGzv

With a lyrical, flowing performance, Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron 🇫🇷 took the ice dancing gold for France at the #Beijing2022 Olympics.
They skated in such unison that there appeared at times to be one skater on the ice instead of two. https://t.co/bk53v79dDX https://t.co/wWwSKN58bo

Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, Eminem, Kendrick Lamar, Mary J. Blige and 50 Cent asserted the power of hip-hop’s oldies generation on pop music’s most-watched stage, our critic @joncaramanica writes of the Super Bowl halftime show. https://t.co/aPkbMHjg4Q
Taking a 90-minute walk, jog or bike ride after your next Covid or flu vaccine might amplify the benefits of the shot, according to a new study.https://t.co/QObhrHqKdQ

Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, Kendrick Lamar, Mary J. Blige and 50 Cent delivered a Super Bowl halftime performance heavy on nostalgia and California pride. Eminem knelt and held his head as he finished "Lose Yourself." https://t.co/8FXs80aZCX

The Super Bowl halftime show on Sunday will feature Dr. Dre, Eminem, Snoop Dogg and Kendrick Lamar, marking the first time that hip-hop sits firmly at the center of the annual spectacle. The genre has taken a roundabout path to get there. https://t.co/Os9ODiwUT6

A Pennsylvania man who hosted what he described as “the alt-right’s favorite firearms-related podcast” was, along with his father, indicted on several gun charges, including owning machine guns and unregistered silencers, according to federal prosecutors. https://t.co/cBX6JrtEQs

A band of anti-Trump Republicans led by Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky is quietly maneuvering to bring allies to Washington and thwart Donald Trump’s bid to retain his hold on the GOP.
The plan is so far yielding mixed results. https://t.co/L9Sc5JUk2v
Chimpanzees have been observed putting flying insects on their wounds. A new report suggests they could be using them to treat injuries.https://t.co/nCMXlShGIH

Rudy Giuliani, who helped lead the effort to overturn the results of the 2020 election, is in talks with the Jan. 6 panel about testifying, according to people familiar with the matter. https://t.co/8yqcFS4XHs

Erin Jackson 🇺🇸 won gold in the women’s 500-meter speedskating race at #Beijing2022, ending a U.S. drought.
She is the first African American woman to medal in the sport. https://t.co/o6twSzasyY https://t.co/6nj1XFf1em

President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine continued to play down U.S. warnings of an imminent Russian invasion, urging calm and saying he had not seen intelligence showing that Moscow was poised to attack. https://t.co/Z1tbQrvHlO

Breaking News: Erin Jackson 🇺🇸 won gold in the women’s 500-meter speedskating race at #Beijing2022, ending a U.S. drought.
She is the first African American woman to medal in the sport. https://t.co/oW72gBzNzT https://t.co/7clVWEtOe9

Breaking News: Canadian police are arresting protesters near Ontario’s Ambassador Bridge, a vital U.S. crossing and major site of recent demonstrations.
Follow our updates. https://t.co/lY4kiX4zWZ

One grocery store worker sells his blood plasma to make ends meet. Another was evicted after struggling to pay her rent. This is the reality for many Kroger employees, who say they can’t afford basic living expenses on their wages from the chain.
https://t.co/wh6j0QIrvK
